message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the behavior of nocturnal predators. Nocturnal predators are animals that are active at night, so they hunt during "sleepy time" or darkness. Option (A) is incorrect because sunrise occurs in the morning when the predators are typically resting. Option (B) is incorrect because daylight is the opposite of the time when nocturnal predators are active. Option (D) is incorrect because the behavior of nocturnal predators is not determined by the season.

This question requires knowledge about the feeding habits of nocturnal predators. Nocturnal predators are active during the night and hunt for their prey during that time. Option (C) refers to "sleepy time," which is synonymous with nighttime and accurately represents when nocturnal predators hunt. Option (A) is incorrect because sunrise happens in the morning, when nocturnal predators are typically not active. Option (B) is incorrect because daylight is when diurnal predators, not nocturnal predators, are active. Option (D) is incorrect because summer is a season and does not specify a time of day.
